content:
{{knowledge objective
|Identifiant=OIC-342-16-A
|Item_parent=Discomfort, loss of consciousness, coma in adults (see item 105)
|Item_parent_short=Discomfort, loss of consciousness, coma in adults (see item 105)
|Rank=A
|Title=Know the symptomatic treatment of malaise
|Description=None
|Heading=Management
|Contributors=
|Order=16}}
First aid treatment - Safety position - Lateral safety position if unconscious - Leg elevation if blood pressure low

question.question: What is the recommended first aid treatment position for an adult experiencing malaise and low blood pressure?
question.option_a: Supine position with legs flat on the ground
question.option_b: Prone position with a pillow under the head
question.option_c: Lateral safety position if unconscious, legs elevated if blood pressure is low
